intro: Lindsaea guianensis var. filipendula, commonly known as the filipendula lindsaea, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is native to South America. It is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on other plants without being parasitic, typically in humid tropical environments. The plant features dense, overlapping leaves that form a rosette, creating a water-holding structure known as a tank. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in shaded, moist forest habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
